meanings.definition: A unit of power equal to one billion watts.
meanings.sent1: The power plant generated one gigawatt of electricity.
meanings.sent2: The solar panel produced a gigawatt of energy in a day.
meanings.sent3: It would take a gigawatt of energy to power a time machine.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm was like a gigawatt of energy, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm crackled with the force of a gigawatt, shaking the windows.

meanings.definition: A gigawatt-hour is equal to one billion watt-hours.
meanings.sent1: The city consumed a gigawatt-hour of electricity during the peak hours.
meanings.sent2: The battery had a capacity of one gigawatt-hour.
meanings.sent3: The gigawatt-hour of energy stored in the battery could power the house for a month.
meanings.sent4: His excitement was like a gigawatt-hour of joy, spreading happiness to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The gigawatt-hour of creativity in her mind fueled her artistic endeavors.
